data.title: Coat-of-Arms of Vanitas
data.meta_description: Coat of Arms with a Skull by Albrecht Durer (1471-1528); engraving; 1503
data.meta_site_name: Victoria and Albert Museum: Explore the Collections
data.text:
Physical description

Engraving by Albrecht DÃ¼rer, âCoat-of-Arms with a Skullâ or âCoat-of-Arms of Vanitasâ; 1503, German. Inscribed with artistâs monogram at bottom centre and dated. A coat of arms bearing a skull is surmounted by a helmet mounted with a pair of magnificent wings and fluttering ribbons or acanthus foliage. At left, a young woman in ornate dress and headdress is caressed by a cloven-hooved, bearded incarnation of the devil.
